intro: Achyrophorus grandidentatus, commonly known as the giant holly fern, is a distinctive fern species characterized by its large, leathery fronds. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is native to the southeastern United States. The plant features prominently veined, bipinnate leaves that can reach lengths of up to three feet. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
